items.content_html:
Part of #8961.

This removes uses of the {{page}} macro from the <input> docs. This change is sometimes needed for Markdown because {{page}} sometimes wanted to select part of a section using a <div>. I suppose I could have kept {{page}} when it wanted complete sections, by adjusting heading IDs, but it seemed better to get rid of it entirely.

So now there is quite a lot of duplication in the lists of attributes on input type pages.

I think what we ought to do here eventually is:

  • make sure every input attribute has its own page under https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes
  • make the input pages just link there, instead of copy/pasting the text around
  • let input pages add extra info for their own type when that's needed

But I didn't want to get into that today.
items.title: [Markdown] [Web/HTML] Remove page macro from input element pages

items.content_html:
On line 195 the sentence instructs us to "Modify your FilterButton <script> like this: "

<script>
   export let filter = 'all'
</script>

However, this is being received as a prop from out Todos component. We should not be setting the variable 'filter' to anything in our FilterButton.svelte. We should just be exporting the variable 'filter' to indicate that we are receiving it as a prop, right ?

Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Anything else that could help us review it

Part of #8961.

This removes some more <div id= from the HTML docs. Almost all live samples.

I haven't yet addressed the heavy use of {{page}} in the input element docs. That's going to take some thought.
items.title: [Markdown] [Web/HTML] Remove DIV IDs from HTML elements, part 2

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The ECMAScript specification is a huge document and takes non-trivial amount of time to load.

Its multipage variant is a lot more user friendly when referring to specific chapters.
items.title: Regular expressions: link to multipage ES spec
Add the type of function

items.content_html:
Spec: https://immersive-web.github.io/layers/#xrrenderstatechanges

  • Adds XRRenderState.layers
  • Rewrites XRSession.updateRenderState to be more accurate and to include the layers option.
items.title: Update XRSession.updateRenderState; add XRRenderState.layers

items.content_html:
This is continued update or HTTP authorisation docs for #8682

This updates the Authorization header with a more detailed explanation.

However most of the work is to add Digest authentication information to WWW-Authenticate.

I'm submitting this, but I do expect that it might require an update. For example, I want to add examples for Digest, and that might tell me that I have misinterpreted part of the spec. I'm pretty sure it is OK though :-)
items.title: Update authorisation header and extend www-auth with digest

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

Fixes #2309

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The focusin/focus and focusout/blur pairs are near identical. A documentation on the differences was requested.

Anything else that could help us review it

I looked this up again and the consensus from Google's first page results was that focusin/focusout bubble while focus/blur don't. This fact is noted in MDN docs' opening lines but the link https://javascript.info/focus-blur provides a more thorough documentation and I have included it in the See Also parts.
items.title: Fixes #2309 adds link for focusin/focus diff

items.content_html: Also fixes some ids and classes that just aren't needed
items.title: Glossary - remove explicit summary in preparation for markdowning

Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

Fixes #7129

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The original example just shows sending an XMLHttpRequest with the formdata event, which can already be done with the submit event. I think it's more useful to show that the formdata event can be used to modify the formdata before it's constructed.

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: update formdata event examples
